bioghist.p: Hertha Kraus (1897-1968) was a German-American social worker and professor of social work at Bryn Mawr College. Kraus came to the United States in 1933 after she was dismissed by the Nazis from her position as Director of Public Welfare for the city of Cologne. In the 1930s and 1940s she was active in the refugee placement programs of the American Friends Service Committee. She joined the faculty of the Bryn Mawr Department of Social Economy and Social Research (later the School of Social Work) in 1936. She retired in 1963.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of personal and professional correspondence and other items relating to Kraus's activities as a social work educator and her involvement with refugee placement programs of the American Friends Service Committee. The collection includes her scholarly articles, course material notebooks, lecture notes, and social work bibliographies. Also included are Kraus's school records and a copy of her dissertation.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
